com.flir.flironesdk

Class FrameProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.flironesdk.FrameProcessor

  • public final class FrameProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class converts from Frame to RenderedImage Processing includes colorizing, MSX fusion, and temperature-accurate thermography.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FrameProcessor.Delegate
      Defines callback for frame processing results

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float EMISSIVITY_GLOSSY
      Glossy emissivity is for reading temperatures of materials such as steel
      static float EMISSIVITY_MATTE
      Matte is the default emissivity and is useful for reading temperatures of skin, wood, and most other household items.
      static float EMISSIVITY_SEMI_GLOSSY
      Semi-glossy is for reading temperatures of semi-reflective materials
      static float EMISSIVITY_SEMI_MATTE 

    • Constructor Summary

      FrameProcessor(Context context, FrameProcessor.Delegate delegate, java.util.Set<RenderedImage.ImageType> types)
      Create a frame processor to convert thermal frames to images that can be displayed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FrameProcessor

        public FrameProcessor(Context context,
                      FrameProcessor.Delegate delegate,
                      java.util.Set<RenderedImage.ImageType> types)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a frame processor to convert thermal frames to images that can be displayed.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context, required to cache calibration data
        delegate - An instance of your delegate implementation which will receive processed frames
        types - A Set of rendered frame types to be delivered to the delegate when processing a frame. While not required, it is recommended to use a java.util.EnumSet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid combination of frame types is given.

    • Method Detail

      • setImageTypes

        public void setImageTypes(java.util.Set<RenderedImage.ImageType> types)
        To receive rendered images, frame type must first be set in order to let the FrameProcessor know which image formats to send to the delegate. Pass an list of ImageType enum values in any combination with the exception of ThermalRGBA8888Image and BlendedMSXRGBA8888Image, which may not be set at the same time. When a frame is processed, each type will be sent to delegate.onFrameReceived
        Parameters:
        types - Set of FrameTypes to be processed. While not required, it is recommended to use a java.util.EnumSet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid combination of frame types are supplied

      • getImageTypes

        public java.util.Set<RenderedImage.ImageType> getImageTypes()
        Gets a read-only set of the currently selected frame types. Do not attempt to modify this set. You may copy the set, make modifications to that copy and then pass it to setImageTypes
        Returns:

        Set the MSX focus point distance parameter
        Parameters:

      • getMSXDistance

        public double getMSXDistance()
        Get the current MSX distance parameter
        Returns:
        current MSX specifying MSX distance in meters

      • lockPalettes

        public static void lockPalettes()
        Locks the automatic gain so that there is a static mapping of temperature to color. Note: this affects all instances of frame processors

      • unlockPalettes

        public static void unlockPalettes()
        Unlocks the automatic gain so that there is a dynamic mapping of temperature to color. Note: this affects all instances of frame processors

      • palettesLocked

        public static boolean palettesLocked()
        Gets the current state of the palette lock.

      • processFrame

        public void processFrame(Frame frame)

      • getProcessedFrames

        public java.util.Map<RenderedImage.ImageType,RenderedImage> getProcessedFrames(Frame frame)
        Process a frame synchronously, returning the set of rendered images in a Map with their types as the keys of the Map.
        Parameters:
        frame - The Frame received from the device or loaded from storage.
        Returns:
        Map of RenderedImages wih their types as the keys.
